refnamediv.refpurpose: Prints human-readable information about a variable

refentry.refsect1:
&reftitle.parameters;
value
The expression to be printed.
return
If you would like to capture the output of print_r, use the return parameter. When this parameter is set to &true;, print_r will return the information rather than print it.

&reftitle.examples; print_r example 
 'apple', 'b' => 'banana', 'c' => array ('x', 'y', 'z'));
print_r ($a);
?>
&example.outputs; 
Array
(
    [a] => apple
    [b] => banana
    [c] => Array
        (
            [0] => x
            [1] => y
            [2] => z
        )
)
return parameter example 'monkey', 'foo' => 'bar', 'x' => array ('x', 'y', 'z')); $results = print_r($b, true); // $results now contains output from print_r ?>
